claim.text: Large language models (LLMs) can effectively plan, coordinate, and execute tasks in open-ended, complex environments.
claim.exact_quote: LLMs, featuring two key components: an Adaptive Knowledge Graph Memory System (A-KGMS) and a Structured Communication System (S-CS) to enhance agent cooperation, can effectively plan, coordinate, and execute tasks in open-ended, complex environments.

evidence.evidence_text: LLMs, featuring two key components: an Adaptive Knowledge Graph Memory System (A-KGMS) and a Structured Communication System (S-CS) to enhance agent cooperation, can effectively plan, coordinate, and execute tasks in open-ended, complex environments.
evidence.exact_quote: LLMs, featuring two key components: an Adaptive Knowledge Graph Memory System (A-KGMS) and a Structured Communication System (S-CS) to enhance agent cooperation, can effectively plan, coordinate, and execute tasks in open-ended, complex environments.

evaluation.key_limitations: The claim is based on the authors' own research and has not been independently verified.

claim.text: The proposed Decentralized Adaptive Knowledge Graph Memory and Structured Communication System (DAMCS) is a decentralized cooperative framework for generative agents.
claim.exact_quote: In this work, we propose a Decentralized Adaptive Knowledge Graph Memory and Structured Communication System (DAMCS), which is a decentralized cooperative framework for generative agents.

evidence.evidence_text: In this work, we propose a Decentralized Adaptive Knowledge Graph Memory and Structured Communication System (DAMCS), which is a decentralized cooperative framework for generative agents.
evidence.exact_quote: In this work, we propose a Decentralized Adaptive Knowledge Graph Memory and Structured Communication System (DAMCS), which is a decentralized cooperative framework for generative agents.

claim.text: DAMCS outperforms both MARL and LLM baselines, specifically in long-term collaborative planning and task efficiency.
claim.exact_quote: These findings highlight the crucial role of both the memory system (A-KGMS) and communication protocol (S-CS) for efficient multi-agent cooperation. In our ablation study, (LLM Mem) agents with only memory could plan better using past experiences but struggled to coordinate efficiently, and agents with only communication (LLM Comm) shared information but lacked deeper reasoning. The full LLM MemComm framework, combining both memory and structured communication, significantly outperformed both, reducing redundant actions and optimizing task distribution. This resulted in a 74% reduction in steps compared to LLM basic agents, showing that both memory and communication are essential for effective collaboration.

evidence.evidence_text: These findings highlight the crucial role of both the memory system (A-KGMS) and communication protocol (S-CS) for efficient multi-agent cooperation. In our ablation study, (LLM Mem) agents with only memory could plan better using past experiences but struggled to coordinate efficiently, and agents with only communication (LLM Comm) shared information but lacked deeper reasoning. The full LLM MemComm framework, combining both memory and structured communication, significantly outperformed both, reducing redundant actions and optimizing task distribution. This resulted in a 74% reduction in steps compared to LLM basic agents, showing that both memory and communication are essential for effective collaboration.
evidence.exact_quote: These findings highlight the crucial role of both the memory system (A-KGMS) and communication protocol (S-CS) for efficient multi-agent cooperation. In our ablation study, (LLM Mem) agents with only memory could plan better using past experiences but struggled to coordinate efficiently, and agents with only communication (LLM Comm) shared information but lacked deeper reasoning. The full LLM MemComm framework, combining both memory and structured communication, significantly outperformed both, reducing redundant actions and optimizing task distribution. This resulted in a 74% reduction in steps compared to LLM basic agents, showing that both memory and communication are essential for effective collaboration.

evaluation.key_limitations: The claim is based on the authors' own research and has not been independently verified. Further testing is required to confirm performance in other multi-agent environments.
